title: 113_s1462
content: The Act is titled the "Railroad Safety and Positive Train Control Extension Act" and sets an implementation deadline. The "Railroad Safety and Positive Train Control Extension Act" mandates the implementation of positive train control systems by railroad carriers according to a specified schedule. The "Railroad Safety and Positive Train Control Extension Act" extends the deadline for implementing positive train control systems on tracks not required to have them until December 31, 2020. The deadline for implementing positive train control systems on tracks not required to have them is extended until December 31, 2020, with a modification to specify that it applies to trains transported on or after December 31, 2015. The Secretary of Transportation has the authority to extend the implementation deadline for positive train control systems until December 31, 2020. The Secretary of Transportation can extend the deadline for implementing a positive train control system in 1-year increments if full implementation is deemed infeasible due to circumstances beyond the applicant's control. The Secretary of Transportation can extend the deadline for implementing a positive train control system in 1-year increments if full implementation is deemed infeasible due to circumstances beyond the applicant's control. The extension considerations include funding availability, spectrum acquisition, technology availability, software development, testing, risk reduction strategies, and interoperability standards. The applicant must demonstrate good faith in implementing the system and present a revised plan for full implementation by December 31, 2022. The Secretary can extend the positive train control system implementation deadline in 1-year increments if full implementation is infeasible due to uncontrollable circumstances. Factors considered include funding, spectrum acquisition, technology availability, and risk reduction. The applicant must show good faith in implementation and submit a revised plan by December 31, 2022. The Secretary will review and approve/disapprove applications within 10 days. Section 20156(e)(2) of title 49, United States Code, is amended. The positive train control system implementation deadline can be extended in 1-year increments under certain circumstances. The applicant must demonstrate good faith in implementation and submit a revised plan by December 31, 2022. Section 20156(e)(2) of title 49, United States Code, is amended to update the definition. The Secretary of Transportation must extend the deadline by 5 years for equipping locomotives operating in Positive Train Control territory, as per the revised regulation in the Code of Federal Regulations.
